page.title: 14HARVEL WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: Harvel Women's Institute was founded in l952 and now has a membership of 35 ladies who come from the surrounding area. It is one of l2 Institutes in the Thameside District of the Kent - West Kent Federation of Women's Institutes. Members meet monthly in the Village Hall for either a practical demonstration or an illustrated talk by outside speakers on a chosen subject, planned by the Committee a year in advance. Classes are arranged for art and craft on a regular basis. We also take part in fund-raising for charities and the Village Hall with jumble sales, sales of craftwork and a stall at the annual Village Fete. Members play in darts, scrabble and bridge tournaments and provide entertainment for our own and other WI's in the district.
